moves.1... e6: The French defense is now my only answer against 1.e4
moves.2. d4 d5 3. Nd2: The Tarasch variation: white's knight can't be pinned by Bb4 and the c3 square can be occupied by a pawn
moves.3... Nf6: 3...c5 is the main line, but this move is less drawish and equally good
moves.4. e5 Nfd7 5. Bd3 c5 6. c3 Nc6 7. Ne2 Qb: The old main line... It allows white less options than 7...cxd4 8. cxd4 f6 which is also good
moves.13... Nxd4: the old d5-fork trick (but on the other side of the board!)
moves.14. Nfxd4 e5 15. Be3 exd4 16. Bxd4 Bc5 1: Here i hoped that the isolated pawn would have given me more attacking chances on e4... Fortunately I was right
moves.21. Bxe4 dxe4 22. Nc2: Trying to create a blockade on e3
moves.22... Bc6: !? risky move, because if white succeeded in blockading the pawn, this bishop would become very passive
moves.23... Qb5: 24. Qxa7 Ra8 is not good for white, so I can avoid the exchange
moves.25... Red8: ! Allowing Qxa7... I have a good attack which is probably enough compensation
moves.26. Qxa7 Rd3 27. b4: ? This pawns will become very weak, maybe Qb6 was better...
moves.28. Rde1: 28. Rf1? Rh3! is crushing, but maybe 28. Ne1 is a better defense
moves.28... e3: ! this pawn is attacked 4 times and can't be taken...
moves.35... Qd4 36. Ne3 Be4: ! Now the perpetual is no longer possible, white has to exchange down into a lost endgame
moves.56... Kxb3 57. g5 hxg5 58. hxg5 g6: After Bf5 it will be easy for black to take the g5 pawn..

opening: French (C06), Tarrasch, closed variation, main line
